Description: Ostracon, large section (four fragments joined) of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel with flaring sides, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior is covered with self-slip and faint traces of at least fifteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393235) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393235)
